H0.text: Insulators are materials that let electrons flow very easily from one atom to another.

H1.text: Conductors are materials that let electrons flow very easily from one atom to another.

H2.text: Non-metals are materials that let electrons flow very easily from one atom to another.

H3.text: Resistors are materials that let electrons flow very easily from one atom to another.

A4.text: Insulators are non-conducting materials with few mobile charges that support only insignificant electric currents.

A5.text: Conductors are objects or materials that allow the flow of charge (electric current) in one or more directions.
